For all those bashing this film, you obviously have no taste what so ever when it comes to film, and did not know that Cabin in the Woods was in fact a satire of the horror genre. Joss Whedon is an absolute genius, and does a fantastic job of parodying the horror genre and showing how cliche it has become while creating a hilarious and unique film that will stand as one of the best of this year.

 It's an alright copy to watch by yourself - maybe with others if you want to fool around with audio/video settings.

 But AS IS, the audio is tinny and uneven (it can actually hurt at times with headphones on - someone amp'd it) and the video's aspect ratio is incredibly narrow (it's obviously been shrunk down to look clearer - because of that stretching to 16:9 makes it look very blurry and of course extremely distorted lol).

 Probably better off to wait for an official dvd/bluray rip, shouldn't be much longer.

@kingda74's comment (not @ him)

 There's a little word called "Satire", probably best to learn what it means before watching it. Makes the movie a little better going into it that way.
